name: Crack Burgers with Home Fries & Sautéed Bell Peppers
description: Flavor-packed burgers with ranch, bacon, and cheddar, served with crispy home fries and sautéed bell peppers for a vibrant, complementary side.

ingredients.name: Yukon Gold Potatoes
ingredients.notes: cut into ½-inch cubes, unpeeled for texture

ingredients.name: Bell Peppers
ingredients.notes: mix of red, yellow, and/or orange for color and sweetness, sliced into strips

instructions: Prepare Burger Patties: In a large bowl, combine ground chuck, sour cream, ranch mix, crumbled bacon, and cheddar. Mix gently. Form into 5 equal patties.
Cook Burgers: Preheat grill or skillet (medium-high). Cook patties 4-5 minutes per side or to desired doneness. Keep warm.
Prepare Home Fries: Wash potatoes and cut into ½-inch cubes (leave skin on for texture). Pat dry to remove excess moisture.

Cook Home Fries: Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes in a single layer. Cook undisturbed for 8-10 minutes until golden and crisp on one side. Flip, then add garlic powder, onion powder, smoked paprika, thyme (if using), salt, and pepper. Cook another 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until crispy and tender. Keep warm.

Sauté Bell Peppers: In another skillet, heat 1.5 tbsp olive oil over medium heat. Add sliced bell peppers and onion. Cook 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until softened and slightly caramelized. Add garlic powder, red pepper flakes (if using), salt, and pepper in the last 2 minutes. Stir well.
Serve: Plate one burger patty with a portion of home fries and sautéed bell peppers.
